diseaseDescription: A destructive fungal disease caused by Pythium and Phytophthora species, leading to water-soaked, sunken black lesions on leaves, pseudobulbs, and roots, spreading rapidly in damp conditions.

culturalCare.title: Sanitation & Isolation
steps: Sterilize pots, media, and tools before reuse
Avoid splashing water to reduce spread

culturalCare.title: Ideal Moisture & Airflow
steps: Provide good air circulation and avoid leaf wetness

chemicalControl.title: Fungicides
steps: Apply metalaxyl, fosetyl-Al, or etridiazole as directed
Use copper sulfate or lime poultice on lesions
Follow safety instructions and wear gloves

ecoFriendly.title: Cinnamon or Copper-Lime Paste
steps: Apply cinnamon or copper-lime paste to cut wounds
Repeat application as needed after rainfall or watering
